title: TABLE group least likely to cross party lines

content.prompt: The table best supports which of the following statements about the two elections for which data are provided?

choices.label: The 1988 and 1990 elections were clear victories for the Democratic party.
Republican voters exhibited greater party discipline in 1990 than they did in 1988.
Independent-leaning Republicans were the Republicans least likely to cross party lines.
Independent-leaning Republicans were the Republicans least likely to cross party lines.
Weak Democrats were the group most likely to vote for Republican candidates.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Describe patterns and trends in data.
